Name: What Yesterday Wept, Today Doth Sing
QuestDesc:
Following Carlotta's guidance, you arrive at the Pentinent's End and reunite with the Troupe. Here, another buried secret of the Order awaits discovery...
The long-awaited Carnevale is finally set to begin. Together with your friends, you are ready to thwart the Fractsidus' schemes during the celebration...

Unlock.Name: If On a Rainy Night a Family
The Maiden, The Defier, The Death Crier

Chapters.Title: Find a way out of the mist

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pero, pero?
I'm not exactly one for formal introductions, Pero.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pero
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pero, pero!
I know this isn't the first time seeing them...

Options.PlotLineKey: Sorry, do I know you?
Your voice sounds familiar.
A talking... box?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uh... Hello, I'm Roccia. We've met before on Brant's ship. I was... in this box.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is Pero, the actual owner of the box. Pero takes good care of me and lets me hang out in it all the time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've never seen Pero warm up to someone so quickly. It must be something in your frequency that it finds interesting.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, what brings you to this beach? It's not exactly a place for a stroll.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You explain what happened to Roccia...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, you were attacked by that dragon and fell off the bridge...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm guessing it was Abby who saved you. It probably exhausted itself and retreated back into your body to rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can still sense Abby's frequency, even if it's faint.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (What triggered Abby to come out? Something it could absorb? But then, why didn't it work?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That dragon's behavior is odd. It never leaves its territory.

Options.PlotLineKey: What is this place?
What is that dragon?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Long ago, this place was a sacred spot for the Order's pilgrims. Then the Dark Tide hit, and all those Reverberations left behind twisted things up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Remnant Clouds from the sea of clouds drew hordes of Tacet Discords here. Now, their whispers fill the air, turning this once holy place of pilgrimage into the "Penitent's End."

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This "Dragon of Dirge," is a local Tacet Discord. It grows by feeding on the others.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We were supposed to pick you up like Ms. Carlotta planned, but... things went sideways.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The truth Ms. Carlotta wants to show you lies somewhere on the isle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But this is not the best place to talk. The mist is thickening... and rain is coming.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The mist is dangerous here. It traps Reverberations, and when it collects enough, they quickly form into Tacet Discords.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Captain—I mean Brant... He went into the mist to rescue people, but he hasn't returned. We think he might be in danger.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I plan to go find him. Once I'm in the mist, my frequency will draw the creepies and crawlies away, so you'll be safer here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just in case, take this to mask your frequency and defend yourself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ta-da! Fireworks Pistol! One shot, and it'll send the Tacet Discords packing.

Options.PlotLineKey: I like it!
Seems kind of basic...
Thanks, but guns aren't my thing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's easy to use. You want to see the upgraded version? Ta-da! Magnum Fireworks Pistol!

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not your style? I have more where that came from... Ta-da! Celebratory Fireworks Bomb. Wait, that's meant for our dinner. Oops, sorry, Pero grabbed the wrong one. Though, at a pinch, it might prove useful…

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, try this instead... Ta-da! Captain's Parley Saber!

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Use it to protect yourself. Our troupe will bring you to our base soon and tell you the truth we've uncovered. I'll join you once I find Brant.

Options.PlotLineKey: I want to see the truth for myself.
I can hold my own in a fight.
I can't let a child do this alone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But the mist is dangerous...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, that's not what I meant. Just... this is going to be risky.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry. I know this place inside out. For a first-timer, though, it might be a bit much.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, fine. It's better you see it for yourself. I'll be glad you don't have to fend for yourself alone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: See that lighthouse? It's the only safe place in the mist. We'll head there. Brant might have taken shelter there, too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once we find him, we'll find the truth you're after.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
On the bridge to the island, you're ambushed by the Dragon of Dirge. You fall off the bridge and land on a beach, surrounded by swarms of Tacet Discord. Roccia, the Fool's Troupe first mate, arrives to help. You find her to be the mysterious person sleeping in her box on the troupe liner.
Roccia tells you that Brant went into the mist alone to rescue survivors. She suggests you wait here for someone from the troupe to pick you up, but you figure that following her might be the faster way to uncover the "truth" Carlotta mentioned. Besides, you can't let a young girl face such danger alone.
Meanwhile, you wonder if Abby intervened to absorb the Dragon's attack because it detected a compatible frequency. But why did the absorption fail? Fortunately, you can still sense Abby's presence within you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The area up ahead is where the sea mist is thickest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Try to avoid the "Dark Phantoms" in the mist. They could turn into Tacet Discords at any moment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We need to pass through it to reach the lighthouse. Stay close and keep your wits about you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Try to avoid the "Dark Phantoms" in the mist. They could turn into Tacet Discords at any moment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tacet Discords! Watch out!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What? I can't control my Forte.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The high levels of corrupted Remnant Energy in the mist are disrupting our frequency stability.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can help with that. See, fighting here is a bad idea. Let's just try to avoid any threats for now.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's that ahead? It seems to be glowing with a different color.
Come... Play with me... Look for me... I'm here...

Dialogues.Speaker: Golden Phantom
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Danger... ahead... Be careful...

Dialogues.Speaker: Golden Phantom
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No... Don't let them enchant you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Golden Phantom
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Over here... Come to me...
Come... Play with me... Look for me... I'm here...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry. They're just Reverberations—potential Tacet Discords in the making.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Some of them are actually our friends... We can follow them to find our way out.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did it lead us this way because it sensed the dragon?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Possibly. Phantoms are sensitive to frequencies, so navigating the mist is second nature for them.
The game isn't over. Here... Come quickly...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think... I've figured out what they're doing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We'll be out of the mist soon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Following the Golden Phantom, you and Roccia narrowly escape the Dragon of Dirge's ambush in the mist...

Dialogues.Speaker: Voice in the Mist
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Stay with us… We are your family, your friends… Why abandon us?

Dialogues.Speaker: Voice in the Mist
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We see your loneliness. You, the quiet and solitary one, always making props on her own...

Dialogues.Speaker: Voice in the Mist
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But you have a kind heart, so much to give… Stay with us… You'll never be alone again…

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Focus. Those are just the Tacet Discords whispering. Don't let them trick you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Voice in the Mist
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Stay with us… We are your family, your friends… Why abandon us?

Dialogues.Speaker: Voice in the Mist
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We see your loneliness. You, the quiet and solitary one, always making props on her own...

Dialogues.Speaker: Voice in the Mist
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But you have a kind heart, so much to give… Stay with us… You'll never be alone again…

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Focus. Those are just the Tacet Discords whispering. Don't let them trick you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Golden Phantom
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Over here... Come to me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Golden Phantom
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No... Don't let them enchant you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Golden Phantom
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Danger... ahead... Be careful...

Dialogues.Speaker: Golden Phantom
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah... Roccia... You found me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll always find you, but maybe don't do this again next time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Golden Phantom
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why? Isn't this your favorite game... I... I wanted to play with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know, but as your friend, I worry about your safety.

Dialogues.Speaker: Golden Phantom
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My... friend...

Dialogues.Speaker: Golden Phantom
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Excuse me. Are you Roccia's friend?

Options.PlotLineKey: Yes, I am.
Not yet, but I think we will be soon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Golden Phantom
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah... How wonderful.

Dialogues.Speaker: Golden Phantom
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're not alone anymore, Roccia.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, I have friends now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Golden Phantom
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm... so happy for you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Golden Phantom
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All is well...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fly, fly to the high heavens. We are born free, and our souls will soar even in death.

Options.PlotLineKey: What exactly are these phantoms?
You were old friends, hm?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Golden phantoms are... Reverberations mixed with the frequencies left behind by people who've passed away.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When someone dies, their Reverberations linger. Usually, they merge into the same cacophony of frequencies that spawns Tacet Discords.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But sometimes, a trace of their final will remains, and the mist shapes this into phantoms.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This lingering will helps the phantoms resist becoming Tacet Discords and instead guide the lost through the mist.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If the mist clears, they'll vanish. If the mist lingers, their fate is sealed. It will only be a matter of time before they merge with other Reverberations and become Tacet Discords.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Their final frequencies tend to cling to certain objects... like this Luceanite here. I collect them as proof that they once lived.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Otherwise... the dragon will devour every last trace of their frequency.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The mist is thinning. That stranded ship ahead looks like...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Guided by the Golden Phantom, the two of you reach the end of the beach. You realize the Golden Phantom is actually a Reverberation—a blend of frequencies from Roccia's fallen friends. It's here to lead her out of the mist with a game she loves. Once its mission is complete, you and Roccia watch it fade away, and the mist around you thins slightly. Together, you continue forward.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A Pilgrim's Sail? Why is it here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In Ragunna, those who break the law are sent to the Order Tribunal for sentencing. Those who violate the sacred doctrines are branded as Fools and sent away on the Pilgrim's Sail.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's said that when the first Dark Tide ravaged Rinascita, the first Primus followed the currents on a rickety boat and met the Sentinel in person. That's where the Pilgrim's Sail tradition came from.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, the Fools retrace the Primus's journey, reflecting on their mistakes along the way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's a strong undercurrent around this isle, likely caused by that first Dark Tide. It drags all Pilgrim's Sails here unless the ship's course is altered.

Options.PlotLineKey: This ship is empty.
Did the passengers all drown?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No Reverberations on the ship, nor in the mist...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The people must have escaped, but with the mist this thick, we need to stay on guard.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pero
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pero, pero!

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This way. Head to the lighthouse.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I hear the sounds of fighting. Watch out. Tacet Discords are gathering.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
As you journey through the mist, you spot a "Pilgrim's Sail," the ship you saw when you first arrived in the city. Roccia explains that all Pilgrim's Sails eventually end up here, carried by the undercurrents to this island—Penitent's End, a place both destination and grave for every Pilgrim's Sail.
The ship appears abandoned. Its passengers must have ventured deeper into the island. With the mist still thick and danger lingering around, you decide to head toward a nearby lighthouse, hoping to find any scattered survivors along the way.
Looks like our brief intermission is over. Time to let the "ghosts" have their moment on stage.
Come on, then! Let the flames of battle ignite our souls!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait... is that Brant?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only Brant would call them ghosts with that kind of flair... It must be him, but I can't tell where he is in the mist.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, let's deal with the trouble here first before we go look for him.

Chapters.Title: Find the source of the sound in the mist

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The show's over, ghosts! Time to take your final bow!

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Watch your back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A marvelous shot! You've earned your stripes, First Mate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're welcome, but if you'd tilted your head just ten centimeters to the left, it wouldn't have been the Discord's head that got popped—it'd be yours.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not on your watch. Besides, fortune always smiles on me. Except in bets.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And we've crossed paths with the Rover again! Can't get luckier than that!

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We shouldn't have let {PlayerName} get caught up in this mess.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {Male=He;Female=She} was worried about us and insisted on coming.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that so? Then our gratitude to you is even greater for your timely aid, {PlayerName}.

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm here to uncover a buried truth.
We're all alive, and that's what counts.
I wouldn't even be here if it weren't for that dragon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To find the brightest truth, one must delve into the deepest shadows. Such bravery deserves to be hailed, my friend.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where is everyone on the Pilgrim's Sail?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was patrolling the coast earlier when I saw their ship drifting into the mist. Time was against us, so I departed alone without alerting the crew.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andreas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: T-thank you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't be afraid. You're safe with us. You've got some skill, you know, holding your own for so long in the trial against the Tacet Discords.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andreas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Trial? Ha, I don't buy into the Order's nonsense.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andreas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've worked hard all my life and stayed true to the Order's teachings about forsaking earthly pleasures for divine favor. And what do I get in return? Heavier taxes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andreas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When pirates ransacked my merchant fleet leaving me with nothing, I turned to the Order for help. They said it was a divine trial and left me to rot.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andreas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I stood before the Sentinel's statue, asking if my suffering was really Their will, but all I got was... silence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andreas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why should I wait for peace in the afterlife when I could be living for today? How is that a crime?

Dialogues.Speaker: Andreas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As for salvation... I don't believe in it, and I certainly don't need it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here's a proposal. How about joining our troupe?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We are wanderers adrift upon the seas. Or perhaps you're more familiar with the name—the Troupe of Fools.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andreas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Troupe of Fools? Could it be...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. We are, like you, by the Order's decree... marked as Fools.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fools on the Pilgrim's Sail often meet their demise in a storm or they're swallowed by the waves... Even if they do survive, they still face hunger, thirst, and the unforgiving wrath of nature.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe it's luck that brought you here so swiftly, and unharmed at that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look around. This is all that remains of the Pilgrim's Sail... This is always their final destination, where the Fools meet their end.

Options.PlotLineKey: Is this the truth Carlotta spoke of?
Is this the place Carlotta said everything ends?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. The pilgrimage is nothing but a banishment in disguise. The path to salvation they speak of doesn't exist.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Otherwise, how could this once sacred place now look like such a hellish wasteland?

Dialogues.Speaker: Andreas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, sacred place? No wonder the others were talking about it on the ship. They believed the Order's promise that prayers at the Sacrificial Arena would grant them forgiveness... They must be heading up the mountain now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I didn't expect their faith to lead them that far.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If only they knew it was just one of the Order's lies.
Captain! First mate! We're here to help!

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: More hands make light work. I called in some help to escort him back to the base once the mist cleared.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, the first mate's foresight is unmatched! Then the three of us can head up the mountain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But beware my friend, by the end of this pilgrimage, you will witness the Order's cruelest deceit. The dangers ahead will only intensify.

Options.PlotLineKey: That's what I'm here for.
No time for doubt. Lives are at stake.
I've got a score to settle with that dragon anyway.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andreas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please, save them... I hope it's not too late.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry. There's more to our troupe than you think.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This Wingray can fly us up the mountain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You two go first. You'll find I'm very convenient to bring along.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright then... All hands, prepare to ascend!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
After battling through swarms of Tacet Discords in the mist, you reunite with Brant, who saved a survivor named Andreas from the Pilgrim's Sail.
Brant and Roccia reveal the grim truth of the pilgrimage: it's a banishment in disguise, and all exiles are marked as "The Fool" by The Order. Brant, Roccia, and their troupe are among those given this title, having been cast out as "The Fools."
Unfortunately, the Order's lies run deep. Andreas tells you in despair that some pilgrims have been misled, believing they will find salvation by reaching the Sacrificial Arena at the island's peak. But that arena is actually the lair of the Dragon of Dirge, a TD that answers not to prayers but devours all frequencies without mercy.
Determined to save those deceived by The Order and to settle your own score with the Dragon, you all set out for the Sacrificial Arena.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tacet Discords, incoming. Stay alert, everyone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These are human footprints. Looks like they're heading to the Arena.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is the only way up. Let's pick up the pace.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Begone, you vexing wretches... The Sacrificial Arena is right there. Let's take them down in one blow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Devout Follower
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, Divinity above, please have mercy on me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Devout Follower
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is this... some kind of test for me? I-I see. No matter how harsh the punishment, I'll take it. Even if... even if...

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even if... it means death?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've never done anything that warrants paying with our lives.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'd wager mercy isn't on the table. However...

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the face of danger and adversity, the stage is set for our grandest act!

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Brant, you handle the Tacet Discords. I've got the dragon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course, but with all due respect... shouldn't the Captain be the one giving the orders?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just playing to our strengths. Take it, or I'll spill the beans about your wine stash.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Aye, aye, First Mate!

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's time to pay for what you've done, Dragon of Dirge.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the Sacrificial Arena, you find a devotee praying for the Sentinel's forgiveness. She is met instead by the Dragon's deadly claws. Fortunately, you manage to save her just in time. Time to make this monster pay.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hic...

Options.PlotLineKey: Abby! I knew you'd be okay!
Abby! I thought I lost you!
Abby! I'll avenge you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course! You think that lil' lizard could take me down? I just took a nap after eating its frequency. Hic...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uh, seriously? You think that lil' lizard could take me down? I just took a nap after eating its frequency. Hic.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks, but no thanks. You think that lil' lizard could take me down? I just took a nap after eating its frequency. Hic.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But seriously, that was close! The fire it breathed almost singed your hair! Good thing I was here to back you up!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As soon as I realized it was a Tacet Discord, I went for it and ate its frequency. Piece of cake! But I gotta say, it was a pretty hefty bite.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I swear I chewed it up, but it was hard to swallow. It wasn't the taste, you know. More like my digestion's been a mess lately. Hic.

Options.PlotLineKey: Is it because of your condition?
Your condition is definitely getting worse.
Exercising more might help with that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's not the point! The real deal is, I found something crazy in its frequency.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You said you somehow experienced empathy with a Tacet Discord back in Jinzhou, right? How about trying that again with this guy?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Trust me! This could be our big break!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
After a hard-fought battle, you defeat the Dragon of Dirge. Just as you're about to finish it, Abby emerges from within you again. Abby quickly explains that it tried to absorb the Dragon's frequency earlier but something was wrong with its absorption ability—a sign that Abby's condition may be worsening.
Still, Abby says that's not the main issue. During the absorption, it sensed something unusual in the Dragon's frequency. Abby urges you to empathize with the Dragon before its frequency fades.
Gehinnom, a wretched soul, mourned by none...
You are reborn to fulfill our sacred rite... Illuminate the path of salvation...
Become the fiery hand of judgment, purging all transgressions...
Cleanse every soul ensnared by their own indulgence...
Those who cannot withstand the trial by fire... shall forever be barred from our pure land...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As you tap into the Dragon of Dirge's memories, a vision unfolds: a man in The Order's uniform places a halo on the Dragon, commanding it to deliver a final judgment to all who approach.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: See? I wasn't lying!

Options.PlotLineKey: The Order found a way to control the dragon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tacet Discords' frequencies are perpetually fading, inching toward their end.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Their only way to maintain their existence is to consume other frequencies as food.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Dark Tide and mist enveloping this isle have drawn in countless Tacet Discords. Their frequencies should have been enough to feed the dragon.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If what you saw is true, then...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Order must've used some trick to control the dragon, making its frequency fade away faster than it should.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That means they could be responsible for why the dragon began attacking all living beings, including humans...

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In time, it ended up becoming a harbinger of death.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I found this during the previous battle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems the Fractsidus had their hand in this case as well.

Options.PlotLineKey: You know of the Fractsidus?
Really? Them again?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mm? So you know them too. Seems we have much to discuss.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our troupe usually earns a living by performing on the nearby islands. Sometimes, we take on escort missions for merchant ships as well. That's how we first got acquainted with the Fractsidus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At first, they were just lurking about, raiding ships. But as the Carnevale drew near, their actions grew suspicious. We noticed them lingering around a certain sea.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remember Cetus the Tidebreaker, the creature that attacked you when we first met?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After we parted ways, we went searching for it to find out what had gone wrong.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is what we found on its tail... another Lycoris.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alas, the Tidebreaker slipped away into the deep, beyond our reach. Still, this bloom leaves no doubt. The Fractsidus is behind its strange behavior.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We saw what they did to the dragon. The Cetus's violent outburst must be their doing as well.

Options.PlotLineKey: They could wreak havoc at the Carnevale.
What if their true target is the Sentinel?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They say the Carnevale is a ceremony to resonate with the Sentinel. Those who claim the Laurel may be graced with a miracle—a direct communion with the divine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At first, we thought you were merely a curious traveler, intrigued by the Carnevale and our Sentinel. But now, seeing how far you've come, there's more to your quest, isn't there?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our troupe has always sought the Laurel, and we won't sit back while others threaten the Carnevale. If they're your foes, then our paths align!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remember I mentioned one of ours who once claimed the Laurel?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He wasn't with us when we first met. But once we reach our base, you can speak with him about the Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It won't be long now. After such an adventure, a well-earned rest awaits.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You share your vision with Brant and Roccia. They theorize that the Dragon of Dirge was once a simple Tacet Discord that fed on frequencies. But now it becomes a harbinger of death under The Order's control and attacks anything in its path. During the battle, Brant also found a Lycoris on the ground, suggesting that Fractsidus is again behind this.
Brant explains that his troupe has faced Fractsidus at sea before. After they parted ways with you, they kept tracking Cetus the Tidebreaker and found a Lycoris on its tail as well. You suspect Fractsidus's plans may involve the Carnevale and the Sentinel of Rinascita. Since Brant's troupe is here for the Carnevale, they are determined to confront Fractsidus with you.
Brant also mentions that a member of their troupe once won the Laurel of Carnevale. He might know about the connections between the Carnevale, the Laurel, and the Sentinel. You decide to seek him out for answers.
Then, you head to the troupe's base together for a brief respite.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here we are, ladies and gentlemen. Allow me to present to you our sanctuary, a haven for all the surviving Fools at the edge of the world.

Options.PlotLineKey: Pretty impressive.
A base... in THIS place?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It is, my friend. We built this base from the ground up, and I dare say it's a triumph worthy of the ages.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They say the most dangerous places are the safest. Penitent's End has always been forsaken, and now, cloaked in the sea of mist, even the Order's envoys wouldn't dare set foot here. It's the perfect refuge for us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The mist does shield us from the Order, but it brings its own set of problems.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Precisely why we must tackle its effects without delay.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the way, if you'd like to speak with Mr. Bardolino, our Laureate, you'll find his tent deep within the base.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Feel free to talk to the others while we handle our tasks. We'll catch up once we're done.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The troupe's base is, surprisingly, hidden in a cavern beneath Penitent's End. The thick mist provides a natural cover, but it remains a perilous environment. Brant and Roccia tell you how to find Bardolino, the former Laureate, and then set off to handle the lingering impact of the mist. They'll meet you again once their tasks are done.

Dialogues.Speaker: Morrias
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Welcome back, Brant! I... I heard a lot of voices coming from the mist. It's scary...

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't be afraid, Morrias. They're all friends from the troupe, people we've sailed with.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You said you want to be a captain, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sailing has its own trials—sea monsters, storms, whirlpools, undercurrents, you name it. When such challenges arise, you've got to trust your helm and your crew.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They'll stand by you through thick and thin, and your job is to guide them safely through it all, till you reach the journey's end.

Dialogues.Speaker: Morrias
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I understand... Everyone has been so good to me, always looking out for me. When I grow up, I'll be a great captain and take care of them too!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's the spirit, kiddo! You've already got the heart of a captain, and that's no small feat. You're the captain of your own ship!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bravery like that deserves rewards. Here, take this.

Dialogues.Speaker: Morrias
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wow, Captain Sparrow's Legends! Thanks, Brant!

Dialogues.Speaker: Morrias
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And... can I maybe have a sip of the stuff you like to drink? The Troupe Strength?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, well... Ahem! That's a special brew for captains who've faced the fiercest storms. When you're ready, your own glass of Troupe Strength will be waiting.

Dialogues.Speaker: Morrias
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Really? I'll work for it!

Options.PlotLineKey: Troupe Strength?
Kids here really seem to trust you.
About the Reverberations in the sea mist...

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a drink made of Waterlamps, fermented, distilled, and aged to perfection. Not for young ones, of course.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We brew it ourselves, each of us with our preferred strength. It's not worth much, but it's one of the few pleasures we can have here…

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As the captain, it's my duty to be the crew's compass. This face must not show any fear or sorrow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This isle is fraught with hidden threats. Many who were banished never made it to join us, claimed by the Tacet Discords. Their Reverberations became part of the mist...

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those who did make it have their own dreams to chase.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Some will eventually leave to follow the call of their hearts, their silhouettes forever etched into the mist.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We hope they find their promised lands. The troupe may be a safe harbor, but it's certainly not the final destination of their journey.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We honor their names and stories in our plays, passing their legacy down through the crew.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Beriarti the Fire Eater, Toscanini the Night Watcher, Fernando the Fish Killer... Their stories remain vivid in my memory. One day, I'll compile them into a book. Mark my words.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Over the years, we've bid farewell to many and welcomed countless new faces... It seems this cycle will never end.

Options.PlotLineKey: Why were you banished?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I was a boy, I saw the Sentinel's statue in the Cathedral of Mercury. Curiosity led me to point at the statue and ask, "How can you say it's the Sentinel when no one has ever laid eyes on it?" I didn't know the consequences that would follow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That question earned me a pilgrimage. At the time, I thought it was some grand adventure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: On the Pilgrim's Sail, I was cared for by other Fools who shared what little they had and shielded me from the grim reality with their kindness and smiles.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But all I could do was watch... as they passed away, one by one. From that day forward, I swore to wipe away the tears of the innocent.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Every adventurer needs a rest, and every ship must find a port. For us, that meant finding a sanctuary.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When we finally reached this forsaken isle, the destination of our pilgrimage, we fought the Tacet Discords to claim our territory and scavenged what we could from the ship's wreckage. From that, we built all this...

Options.PlotLineKey: A remarkable achievement.
There's something bittersweet in that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though the night may be long, the dawn always follows! That, my friend, is what we should set our sights on.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sithos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Arragh!

Dialogues.Speaker: Budd
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha! Eat this!

Options.PlotLineKey: What are you doing here?
Hey! No fighting!

Dialogues.Speaker: Hymer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who are you? A new recruit? Can't you see we're trying to have a fistfighting contest here? Back in the day, a brawl like this was the pride of the streets!

Dialogues.Speaker: Hymer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: People from every district used to gather on a certain bridge over the river. And first one to toss their opponent into the water got the bridge and the bragging rights.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hymer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The victors were hailed as champions, their names sung in the streets. They earned titles and glory beyond measure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hymer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a shame the Order banned it. What was their excuse again? Oh, right—"breaking solidarity among citizens."

Dialogues.Speaker: Hymer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's madness! A good brawl was a way to blow off steam and ease some of the hostility between the people before it grew into something dangerous.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hymer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And look where we are now. No more epic matches, just a simmering pot of trouble. Can't make sense of it...

Options.PlotLineKey: Why were you banished?

Dialogues.Speaker: Sithos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I got caught smacking someone with a stick in the street.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hymer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, I gave him that stick.

Dialogues.Speaker: Budd
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And I'm that someone.

Options.PlotLineKey: Eh... that's the reason you were all banished?
You all seem to get along well now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Budd
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whether it was for a good reason or not, as soon as you break the Order's doctrines—fraternity, Ragunna's "unity," or whatever—you're sent off on pilgrimage.

Dialogues.Speaker: Sithos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once on board the Pilgrim's Sail, we only had each other to rely on. Out here, sticking together is the only way to survive.

Dialogues.Speaker: Budd
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Speaking of which, we never did settle who won that fight, did we?

Dialogues.Speaker: Sithos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, now that you mention it, we didn't.

Dialogues.Speaker: Budd
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then let's do it now! C'mon! Let's go!

Options.PlotLineKey: Again? But you're friends now!
I certainly won't interfere...

Dialogues.Speaker: Hymer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, don't worry, they've been at this a hundred times before! How about a wager? I'll put up my lucky half-coin!

Dialogues.Speaker: Hymer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then again... neither of them ever actually wins, do they? Betting might be a waste... Eh, who cares? It's the fun that matters!

Dialogues.Speaker: Flustered Troupe Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: First Mate! What should we do with these stage props?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Load the light boxes on the heavy suitcases. Place the lights on top and secure them with chains. Keep the fireworks well away from the curtains.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And don't forget to check the freshwater reserves and all cabin doors.

Dialogues.Speaker: Flustered Troupe Member
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Roger!

Options.PlotLineKey: The first mate has quite the workload.
I'm starting to wonder who's really running the ship.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Usually, the crew handles these jobs themselves.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But since we're prepping for the Carnevale and working on stage setups, it's fair they ask for my advice.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here, the role of captain is best suited to someone who can ease the newcomers' fears and worries.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Brant is a natural. As for me, I'm more comfortable managing these kinds of tasks.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There, there. Don't be afraid...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The frequencies mixed in the mist are unsettling Lario. I'm trying to calm it down so the crew can board.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wanna give it a try? Just place your hand on its forehead and channel your Resonance Energy, like this...

Options.PlotLineKey: (Reach out your hand.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Lario
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *Soft, reassured noises*

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You really are special... The Echoes here are naturally drawn to you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Echoes can sense and respond to human frequencies. They reflect how we treat them, for better or worse.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're like reflections of who we each are.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've heard Lario's scientific name is Pliosaurus Somnii, an incredible creature first seen in the dream of its discoverer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It used to escort our ships across the seas, and then, of its own accord, became our stage. It has braved countless storms with us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Throughout our many travels, we've never found another like it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It must've been lonely, after so many years alone, drifting... That's why it chose to sail with us.

Options.PlotLineKey: Why were you banished?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I was young, much younger than I am now, I performed in a play that was banned by the Order.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And... that was it. I was sent here with all the other performers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The play was about freedom, love, and hope. How could something so beautiful be considered taboo? I... I don't understand.
Relax, young man. Life's only just unfurling its sails for you. Why sit there like one of those dour statues in the Order's halls? Don't be afraid to show a little spark!

Dialogues.Speaker: Andreas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... I was just thinking about my future. Is Ragunna truly lost to me forever?
Ah, some have found their way back, but under the Order's watchful eye. Is that really what you want? A life without freedom?
Listen, you don't need a grand stage to leave your mark. A true Ragunnesi can turn even a ragged tent into the finest theater. That's what I'm preparing to do.
I might be an old man now, but don't let that fool you. I was once crowned with the Laurel, you know!

Dialogues.Speaker: Andreas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You? A-are you... Mr. Bardolino?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bardolino
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the flesh! Hahaha!

Options.PlotLineKey: Did anything unusual happen to you when you had the Laurel?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bardolino
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As I took my final bow on stage, a bright light pierced through the clouds, shining down from the sky. And then, a radiant Laurel descended upon me. And I heard a voice—it was the Sentinel's voice, ringing in my head.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bardolino
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I asked Them a question that had puzzled me since childhood, the ultimate philosophical riddle—"What should I eat tonight?"

Dialogues.Speaker: Bardolino
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And They answered, "The body is the temple of the mind. To keep your mind sharp, do consume healthy food, such as the Laurus Salad."

Dialogues.Speaker: Bardolino
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But why Laurus Salad? I was baffled, and the meaning still eludes me to this very day. I've never been quick-witted though, and the Order's doctrines never quite took hold. Acting, however, that is where my true passion lies...

Options.PlotLineKey: Perhaps that's just the Sentinel's personal favorite...
I must say, your question is rather interesting...

Dialogues.Speaker: Andreas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But why did a blessed Laureate like you get banished by the Order?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bardolino
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Back when I won the Laurel, Ragunna was led by the Holy Maiden. She promoted all sorts of grand celebrations during the Carnevale, an unceasing tide of revelry...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bardolino
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Stages sprang up on every corner of the city, performances dancing through the streets, and shops adorned in vibrant hues. Even on rainy nights, you could still hear music playing in the square.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bardolino
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Some performers wove their critiques into their acts. Sharp as she was, the Holy Maiden noticed. She refined city policy with each whisper of dissent.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bardolino
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, those were the golden days, my friend. The Holy Maiden once said that if she were to leave this world, she'd want no majestic tomb or a solemn funeral, but the grandest Carnevale as her final farewell.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bardolino
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And then... she really did leave us. The current Primus took her place, and in the name of "mourning the Holy Maiden," issued all sorts of bans on the Carnevale. But is that really what she would have wanted?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bardolino
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Order's grip tightened, and the Carnevale performances were reduced to dull, monotonous shadows of their former selves.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bardolino
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One year, I strung a wire from a Gondola to the top of the clock tower in Liberty Square, and another from the tower to the Fisalia's mansion.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bardolino
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then, I disguised myself as one of the La Guardia to fool the Acolytes and climbed to the roof along the wire...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bardolino
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Midway through the Order's performance, I hopped on a Wingray with a Cloudcaster, showering the entire city with flowers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, it was a magnificent sight. The Wingray soared higher than the Acolytes could reach. They couldn't do anything but watch golden-pink petals rain from the sky for three whole days.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They struggled to clean up the flowers from the streets, and it took a downpour to wash them all away. That Cloudcaster, adapted from a music van, became the prototype for the one we use on stage today.

Options.PlotLineKey: Exactly what I'd expect from a Laureate.
No wonder you got banished by the Order...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bardolino
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But that's all in the past! To this day, I'm still not sure what crime they pinned on me. Maybe walking the wire without protection? Ha!

Dialogues.Speaker: Bardolino
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, I'm just an old relic now. But you lot, you're the main characters of this era, facing down every obstacle with fire in your bellies!

Dialogues.Speaker: Andreas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But isn't our fate already sealed? Without the so-called "salvation" the Order preaches, we're doomed to our banishment. Just lost souls, dying in obscurity...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Life is short, and we weren't born just to atone. The Order may banish us, but they can't take away our right to sing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Death is one of many possible ends, but it's certainly not the worst. Perhaps being forgotten is what the Order wanted for us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They want to erase all traces of our existence, grind us into dust, and drag us into the abyss... But we'll fight the tide and live our lives to the fullest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Members of the troupe may come and go, but they've never truly left us. Their deeds and songs are passed down through the ages.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One day, our voices will echo across every land, our words will reach every corner of the world, and by then, even the Tacet Discords in the Stormy Sea will know our names.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bardolino
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's the spirit, boy! Even if I can't earn myself a proper title, I'll become Rinascita's most enigmatic legend. When I'm gone, I'll leave behind a coffin that sings, or maybe turn into a lark, singing every day and night...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You finally meet Bardolino, the former Laureate, and learn that the rumors are true: the Laureate has the ability to communicate directly with the Sentinel.
As Bardolino speaks, he fondly recalls Fleurdelys, the Blessed Maiden, and her reign. He disapproves of Fenrico, and Brant and Roccia join him, using the moment to share the troupe's ideals with those gathered around.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bardolino
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What say you, Brant? Do you like this stage design? It could be used for this year's Carnevale!

Options.PlotLineKey: What... are you doing?
Nice balloons.
Have you considered how you're going to get down?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bardolino
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our little chat reminded me of those good old days, so why not relive that scene I just mentioned? I still remember that famous line: "Even without wings, we can still soar to the heavens!"

Dialogues.Speaker: Bardolino
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now that you mention it, that's a very good question! Hahaha...

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please don't mind him. We like our performances big and bold, after all.

Options.PlotLineKey: There's something else I'd like to ask—
This place doesn't seem very safe...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That fight with the dragon probably messed with the mountain's stability. If Bardolino keeps moving around up there, it could get dangerous. We need to find a way to get him down, and fast.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We might need your help with this, {PlayerName}... Pero should have some useful items in her box.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We've got a Cloudcaster that can conjure up some fluffy Cloud Cushions. They'd make the perfect stairs to reach Mr. Bardolino, or catch him for a soft landing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But some of its parts have been borrowed by other troupe members...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Excited by the conversation, Bardolino suddenly pulls out a bundle of balloons, ties them to himself, and floats up into the air—a recreation, he claims, of his old performance. "Even without wings, we can still soar to the heavens," he passionately quotes. However, he hasn't quite figured out how to land.
Concerned, you start thinking about how to bring him down. Roccia suggests using Cloud Cushions created by a device called the "Cloudcaster." Unfortunately, she admits that some of its parts have been borrowed by other troupe members, so you'll need to retrieve them first.

Chapters.Title: Acquire the base of the Cloudcaster from Lavito

Dialogues.Speaker: Levito
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sailors cheer as hearts ignite, soon we'll break these chains so tight. Set the course, embrace the storm, sailing on 'til light is born...

Options.PlotLineKey: What are you doing?
Why were you banished?
Did you borrow some of the Cloudcaster's parts?

Dialogues.Speaker: Levito
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, hello! I'm writing a sea shanty!

Dialogues.Speaker: Levito
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did you know, Ragunna gondolier's songs are usually in 3/4 time. It matches the flow of water perfectly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Levito
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When they row, their strokes go "slow dip, quick lift," which fits that rhythm.

Dialogues.Speaker: Levito
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But for our troupe, we use a 4/4 signature with strong and weak beats. It's catchy and perfect for sailors to sing along to as we work together to tackle the waves.

Dialogues.Speaker: Levito
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Actually... boarding the Pilgrim's Sail was my choice.

Dialogues.Speaker: Levito
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I used to compose hymns for the Order. Sounds prestigious, hm?

Dialogues.Speaker: Levito
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But the same old rhythm and lyrics started to wear on me. Music should be alive! So I decided to take the pilgrimage, believing I'd find new inspiration from the divinity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Levito
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmph, you probably already know what the pilgrimage really is. I was foolish to believe the Order's lies, but luckily, the troupe found me and brought me in. Ah, have you seen any of our performances perhaps?

Dialogues.Speaker: Levito
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We don't do those lofty soliloquies that give you existential dread. That doesn't mean our plays are shallow—they're just more hopeful and speak directly to the heart.

Dialogues.Speaker: Levito
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We do Commedia Improvviso, a style of play that's all about those fleeting, beautiful moments of everyday life.

Dialogues.Speaker: Levito
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We sing of love that endures, enemies who become allies in the fight against evil...

Dialogues.Speaker: Levito
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Order may scoff at such stories, but they're real, human stories—full of ambition, dignity, and everything that makes us human.

Dialogues.Speaker: Levito
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Traveling with the troupe, I've learned to see the beauty in the small things, and I've met people facing similar and unique life struggles.

Dialogues.Speaker: Levito
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only those who walk in the fields can really see how the crops grow. It's the same with music. You can't truly know it until you've listened.

Dialogues.Speaker: Levito
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's why I'm always chatting with the crew, gathering ideas for my ballads and shanties—the true rhyme of our time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Levito
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Cloudcaster... Oh, I use its base as a desk. Our first mate lent it to me so I could write more comfortably.

Dialogues.Speaker: Levito
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here it is. Careful, it's heavy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After talking to the troupe member, you managed to retrieve one of the Cloudcaster's parts.

Chapters.Title: Acquire the resonance unit of the Cloudcaster from Tina

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Soft singing)

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'd rather be a wild flower, ignored by all, in my own power. Than a rose that bends and sways, bathed in grace, but lost in dismay...

Options.PlotLineKey: What are you doing?
Why were you banished?
Did you borrow some of the Cloudcaster's parts?

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Isn't it obvious? I'm practicing for the Carnevale!

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm the troupe's soprano and helmswoman. Steering Rinascita's Echo ship isn't just about strength, it's about resonating with the Echoes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After years at sea, I've learned that some Echoes are sensitive to our songs and will react to them in different ways.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Order warns of sirens lurking in the Stormy Sea's mists, but they don't scare me. I'll show them who the real siren of these waters really is!

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who knows? Ask the Order and they'll give you a hundred reasons.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't even remember how long I drifted on that Pilgrim's Sail, but the troupe found me just in time and took me in.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's past is past. It's the present that counts. Let go of the bad days and enjoy the moment. This is the way to live, hm?

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cloudcaster... Hmm, it does ring a bell.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Here, the resonance unit. It helps me find the right pitch and rhythm. Works like a charm! You should give it a try too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After talking to the troupe member, you managed to retrieve one of the Cloudcaster's parts.

Chapters.Title: Acquire the reel of the Cloudcaster from Battier

Dialogues.Speaker: Battier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: C'mon, fish. Come to my net.

Options.PlotLineKey: What are you doing?
Why were you banished?
Did you borrow some of the Cloudcaster's parts?

Dialogues.Speaker: Battier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Me? Just prepping dinner. The storm's passed, so it's the perfect time for fishing!

Dialogues.Speaker: Battier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The captain once told me a secret: the fiercer the storm, the more fish it brings. Sometimes we even see fish swept up by the wind, raining down from the sky!

Options.PlotLineKey: Only fish on the menu?
Uh, are you sure this is legal?

Dialogues.Speaker: Battier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Usually, yeah. But when we dock on an island, the captain and first mate will buy some other food from the locals.

Dialogues.Speaker: Battier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Legal? Ha, who cares! We're not even a legitimate troupe according to the Order.

Dialogues.Speaker: Battier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Back in Ragunna, I was just a fledgling fisherman when I accidentally caught an Orastie.

Dialogues.Speaker: Battier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Turns out it's a sacred fish, only meant as an offering to the Sentinel. Mortals aren't allowed to catch it… but it swam right into my net! Not really my fault, was it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Battier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though, the Order didn't see it that way. They banished me here, like tossing a fish onto dry land.

Dialogues.Speaker: Battier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Luckily, the troupe found me. I can still fish like I used to. Otherwise, I'd probably be dead or living as a pirate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Battier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Though, to be honest, life here ain't too different from a pirate's, except we're not hunting for treasure but for smiles and cheers from our punters!

Dialogues.Speaker: Battier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah. I borrowed the reel for my fishing rod.

Dialogues.Speaker: Battier
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We scavenge all sorts of stuff from the beach and fix them up as needed. Nothing goes to waste! Don't be fooled by appearances, this stuff can be pretty versatile!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After talking to the troupe member, you managed to retrieve one of the Cloudcaster's parts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good, we have all the parts now. Time to work, Pero.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Roccia makes quick work of repairing the Cloudcaster.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everything's set for takeoff.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's position a Cloud Cushion beneath Mr. Bardolino. Then, we'll pop the balloons to bring him down safely.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Although, we might need a bigger cushion.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Cloudcaster's resonance unit responds to song. The louder our singing, the more powerful the effect.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In that case… Alright, friends, old and new, come and join this sing-along!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You assemble the Cloudcaster and generate Cloud Cushions beneath Bardolino. The next task is to pop the balloons and bring him safely down. The Cloudcaster's resonance device responds to songs, so the troupe members sing together to expand the Cloud Cushion.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bardolino
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, what a joyful chorus! It almost brings back the splendor of that Carnevale from years past…

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I know you're excited, Mr. Bardolino, but try to stay still.

Chapters.Title: Shoot the balloons to rescue Bardolino

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bullseye! How about showing off that aim again with the rest of the balloons?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Almost done...

Dialogues.Speaker: Bardolino
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, dear {Male=boy;Female=girl}! You helped me complete this performance and fulfill one of my dearest wishes. Please, I'll gladly give you my most prized possession!

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Apologies for my late arrival to such a magnificent performance. Did I miss anything?

Dialogues.Speaker: Bardolino
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh my, oh my! What an honor to witness the beauty of our generous benefactor! Thank you, my lady, for rescuing this humble soul in his moment of need...

Options.PlotLineKey: You're a sharp shooter, Carlotta.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You flatter me. The family's protection extends to all who stand by us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Might I say what a pleasure it is to see you again, Ms. Carlotta! You have my heartfelt gratitude!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Bardolino lands safely and bows in thanks. Just then, a piece of rock falls from the cavern ceiling, headed straight for him. Carlotta, who has arrived at some point, steps forward and shatters the rock before it can strike him.
She approaches you, and you acknowledge each other with a simple nod. The Montelli family's protection extends to all who stand by them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is everything going smoothly with your family, Ms. Carlotta?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, thank you. The Order's scheme was uncovered as planned. Uncle Capollo was rescued, and <ano=Head of the Montellis>Grandfather</ano> has handled the rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I still owe you thanks, {PlayerName}, for improvising with me in front of that Priest.

Options.PlotLineKey: Don't worry. Your help has more than repaid your debt.
That's what I should say. You've always been helping me, with or without my knowing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've got a sharp mind. No pain, no gain, as Grandfather used to say. I'm pleased we're on the same page.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your kindness is much appreciated. The Montellis won't forget this. In return, I'll share everything I know.

Options.PlotLineKey: So, the Order has been targeting the Montellis.
No need to thank me, we share a common enemy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I believe you've noticed that the Order has been undermining the family under the guise of its doctrines. Alienation, monopolization—just a few tricks up their sleeve. Their true motives, however, run deeper.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Their alliance with the Fractsidus speaks volumes. While we don't know the full extent of their conspiracy, one thing is clear: their sights are set on this year's Carnevale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, the Carnevale is likely where you'll find clues about the Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Legend has it that the Sentinel, Imperator, has been secluded in the heavens, cut off from the mortal realm. The last record of the Sentinel is from the Carnevale a decade ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At that time, the entire city was shrouded in mist. Ghosts roamed the streets, a dragon roared from the sky and a sea behemoth raged, summoning towering waves... Do any clues come to mind?

Options.PlotLineKey: (Sort out the clues about Queen of the Night)
(Sort out the clues about the Vault Guards)
(Sort out the clues about the Dragon of Dirge)
(I've already figured out their schemes)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The mist might be coming from the Remnant Clouds in the Nimbus Sanctum. Lorelei has the power to purify and control them, but the Fractsidus interfered…

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remnant Clouds corrupted by evil will disrupt Echoes' frequencies. If the mist had spread to the city, it would have stirred the Echoes into chaos.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We are lucky that you and Zani, along with that Acolyte, awakened Lorelei in time. You prevented the mist from spreading and averted the Waveworn. The Fractsidus must still be licking their wounds.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Montelli traitors used Lycoris in experiments to turn Echoes back into Tacet Discords... If they were successful, the "ghosts" seen ten years ago may have also been created this way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Ghost" is just a dramatic name given by the Ragunnesi for Tacet Discords. They look nearly identical to Echoes, especially in the mist.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With your help, Grandfather has thwarted their plan. No corrupted Echoes will appear at this year's Carnevale.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Order has allied with the Fractsidus to control the dragon... From what I saw when I connected with its frequency, they might be planning to command it to attack Ragunna during the Carnevale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After the Tacet Discords took over this isle, the Order used them as an excuse to forbid any entry. It might be their way of concealing the dragon's existence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But without the Lycoris, the Dragon of Dirge is now off the table.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Remnant Clouds spreading, experiments to turn Echoes, and the dragon's manipulation... The Order plans to recreate these disasters at this year's ceremony.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Order and the Fractsidus are allies. To prevent the Carnevale's sabotage, we must stop them. But... what is their motive?

Options.PlotLineKey: The Order clearly has the option of not reviving the Carnevale.
Is there a reason the Order has to let the Carnevale happen?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Primus called it a divine punishment and took the opportunity to appear as a savior. A perfect way to build legitimacy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Order relies on the people's faith in the Sentinel. With the Sentinel's ten year absence, faith in the Order has waned. They must be desperate to restore that trust.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It is for this reason that the Order has been forced to revive the festival.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's consider the implications. If the Carnevale proceeds unhindered, how would it affect the Order?

Options.PlotLineKey: (Bring up the prophecy about the Holy Maiden's coronation)
(Bring up the Sentinel's inability to communicate with mortals)

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The current Primus claims to be the Enlightened One, the Sentinel's Resonator. However, based on the prophecy we found in the ruins, this role is meant for the young maiden who is destined to heed the divine oracles during the Carnevale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Carnevale is the only time humans can directly communicate with the Sentinel. Normally, it's the Primus who conveys the Sentinel's words.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A successful Carnevale offers a chance for citizens to meet the Sentinel in person. But for the Primus, and possibly the Order, it poses a threat if they've been fabricating the oracles.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To sabotage it while still maintaining their authority... they partnered with the Fractsidus.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fractsidus will cause chaos during the Carnevale, and the Order will swoop in as the saviors, restoring public trust just as they did before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So far, you've helped us crush three of their schemes, but one remains...

Options.PlotLineKey: The sea behemoth summoning towering waves...
Cetus the Tidebreaker?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We have evidence that the Cetus is being manipulated, and the Fractsidus are setting up their final plan. With their whereabouts unknown, we'll need to adapt our strategy as the Carnevale unfolds.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From what I've noticed, you're not one to act passively or pin your hopes on others. You prefer to strike first and steer events in your favor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Winning the Laurel might give you the chance to talk with the Sentinel. The Sentinel's Resonator may also be present. So...

Options.PlotLineKey: You've guided me this far for it.
You want me to join you in stopping the Fractsidus.
You want me to join the troupe's performance at the Carnevale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our aim has always been clear—to restore the Carnevale to its former glory with a performance for the ages.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If the divine truly exists, would they wish to see their people living without freedom or witness a festival twisted into a tool for tyrants?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If we win the Laurel, we'll show that such punishment is absurd. But if that's truly their design... we shall break those divine shackles ourselves.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whether divinity exists or not, we will fight for Ragunna's freedom, where everyone has the right to live and pursue a future of their own choosing!

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Montellis share this vision. Only in a free society can a fair and open market thrive.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However, the troupe alone is too weak, the family is under close watch, and our enemy hides in the shadows... We need your strength to find our way forward.

Options.PlotLineKey: I agree. Count me in.
We're united by the same goal.
Seems there's no other way to meet the Sentinel than at the Carnevale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you. I'm pleased we've reached an agreement once more.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Carlotta tells you that the Montelli family's trouble is temporarily resolved. She and you then piece together recent events. You realize that The Order intends to recreate the crisis that wrecked the Carnevale ten years ago.
The Order has maintained its power through communication with the Sentinel, but with the Sentinel's absence for ten years, faith in the Order has waned. Also, Primus Fenrico does not match the description of the "Enlightened One." Desperate to restore public trust, the Order has been "forced" to revive the festival. However, if the Carnevale enables direct communication with the Sentinel, The Order's deceptions will be exposed.
Their plan seems clear now: by causing chaos through Fractsidus, The Order can then intervene as "saviors" and regain the people's trust without undermining their authority. Although you've foiled some of Fractsidus's schemes, threats still loom. The troupe has discovered that Cetus the Tidebreaker is still under their control, and it's likely that a Fractsidus Overseer will make an appearance at the Carnevale.
To reach the Sentinel, winning the Laurel—which grants a chance to communicate directly with the Sentinel—may be your best option.
With a shared goal, Carlotta becomes your ally. Now, you just need to decide how to carry out your plan.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, what should we do now? Any plans?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Since the Order intends to sabotage the Carnevale and incite chaos amongst the guests, confronting them directly only plays into their hands.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've seen the troupe's unique approach to combat, haven't you? That's precisely why we're allies with them. We will turn any disturbances into a theatrical performance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, I can see our friend here is still a bit confused. No worries, my dear {Male=boy;Female=girl}. We'll have a quick rehearsal before the Carnevale begins.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Speaking of which, Ms. Carlotta, would you honor us by joining our performance?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Me? I do have some stage experience, though I must confess I may be a bit out of practice...

Options.PlotLineKey: I need a stage partner.
We need your expertise.
I'm not familiar with stage performance, and I need your guidance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We don't know what challenges we'll face, so your help will be needed, Ms. Carlotta. Plus, it's a chance for you to get to know our methods.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you insist.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wonderful! As the festivities continue, if you're both ready, please join us on the stage of the troupe liner.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The Order's goal is to disrupt the Carnevale, sowing fear and unrest. But if you confront them directly, you risk fueling the crisis they hope to exploit.
Carlotta proposes working with the Fool's Troupe to turn any potential disturbance into a staged performance, stripping chaos of its impact.
Brant and Roccia see your hesitation and invite you to join their upcoming rehearsal and get comfortable with the troupe's style.
Don't forget to bring Carlotta along. If you're ready, take your place on the troupe liner's stage.

Chapters.Title: Board the liner and prepare for the rehearsal

Dialogues.Speaker: Andreas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I didn't expect the troupe's secret base to look like this...

Options.PlotLineKey: What are you planning to do next?

Dialogues.Speaker: Andreas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Honestly, I... I'm still not sure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andreas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Order is only banishing the so-called "heretics" for now, but... will they really stop at this? I can't bring myself to imagine the possibilities...

Dialogues.Speaker: Andreas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They control everything. Fighting them with our strength alone would be impossible.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andreas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe I should leave the troupe... Or perhaps I'll stay and gather strength here with others who believe in our cause.

Dialogues.Speaker: Andreas
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I share the troupe's ideals. We'll breathe freedom into Ragunna, a wind that will one day shake its walls of lies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our rehearsals are rather straightforward. No scripts, just pure intuition and our senses guiding us! That's what makes Commedia Improvviso truly come alive!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For our improvised comedy, we start with a theme. From there, we build our lines and act on the fly, responding to the unfolding show and audience reactions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But with the limitless capacity for human creativity at play, the plot can sometimes veer into the... well, unconventional. To prevent things from spiraling too far, we set an "anchor" for the performance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pardon my interruption, but I'm quite curious. What sort of bizarre plots have you encountered?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, something like "A humble craftsman from a small town sets sail on a rainy night, stumbles upon ancient ruins, is reincarnated with super powers, and then decides to conquer the galaxy, becoming the Emperor of the Stars..."

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So, we draft a basic outline that assigns roles and guides the plot's direction.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And this time, our outline is: "A kingdom is attacked, monsters run rampant, and the Demon King has kidnapped the Holy Maiden. A few brave heroes accept the minister's quest to defeat the Demon King and rescue her."

Options.PlotLineKey: A real classic, no doubt.
Sounds a bit cliché...
So, a classic adventure story.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This outline holds special meaning. We want to pay tribute to the play once performed by the Blessed Maiden herself, which was also about a hero facing a Demon King.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
