Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good people have their wishes fulfilled, heroes appear in a time of crisis, justice triumphs over evil, and united friends are undefeatable.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is the tale the Blessed Maiden once told, and it's a universal story we want to portray.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To me, the world is a stage, and performing is much like combat. Coordinated movements, quick thinking, sharp reflexes, and, above all, trust in your allies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What I'm getting at is that you both are very skilled and capable. We don't have many dos and don'ts, so relax and express yourselves freely on stage!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This rehearsal is to help you get familiar with basic stage movements, techniques, and the troupe's style, and to build good rapport.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Exactly. I'll handle the stage lighting, Brant will narrate, and the rest will take on the role of the audience.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you're ready, let's begin! Everyone, a big round of applause to welcome the Rover and Ms. Carlotta on stage!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Brant and Roccia introduce you to Commedia Improvviso, the troupe's improvisational show.
Although the performance is largely unscripted, they've prepared a simple outline—a classic story of "a hero's victory over the Demon King," the very tale that Fleurdelys once performed to win the Laurel.
The world is your stage, they tell you, so relax and express yourself freely. Actions speak louder than words—now, take the stage!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, next, I'll spin the prologue of our tale, setting the scene for how our brave heroes first crossed paths...

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once upon a time, a hero roamed the world. Undaunted by the lack of a divine vessel, {Male=he;Female=she} embarked on a perilous journey across tempestuous seas...

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alone in the dark, a young girl of untethered spirit, soared against towering barriers with wings of defiance...

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The winds of fate brought them together...

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As the world teetered on the brink of absolute darkness, they found solace in each other's gaze...

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Together, they became unshakable allies, standing strong against the tides of fate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even if light were to fade from the world, and the stars cease to shine, they would still blaze like the sun, forever...

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bravo! Bravo!

Options.PlotLineKey: So this is what a Commedia Improvviso feels like.
How did this suddenly turn into a musical?
It had a romantic flair.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha, seeing your chemistry, I decided to take a little creative liberty with the story. Anyway, it didn't stray too far from the outline, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The thrill of improvisation is in its unpredictability. There's always a rush of excitement with every twist and turn.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your movements were seamless, elegant, and powerful. I'm confident you'll shine at the Carnevale!

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you. It was all thanks to {PlayerName}. You inspired me and kept my spirits high.

Options.PlotLineKey: Am I blushing, or is that just the spotlight?
Carlotta is the real genius here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You'll master it in no time, I'm sure! Alright, that's enough for today. Let's save the grand reveal for the Carnevale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, and speaking of which, there's still something we need to prepare for you, isn't there, {PlayerName}?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You mean the essential item for the Carnevale performance?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry. I've taken care of everything.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, so it's handled then? I can't wait to see it!

Options.PlotLineKey: You've piqued my curiosity.
What could be so mysterious?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have a small gift for you. Let's head back to Ragunna together, shall we?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Brant and Roccia praise your performance with Carlotta, expressing confidence that you'll master the art of acting by the time the Carnevale begins.
But before that, Brant brings up that you still need one final thing to participate in the festival.
Fortunately, Carlotta has it all prepared. Follow her back to Ragunna City.

Chapters.Title: Meet up with Carlotta in Ragunna City

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Tell me, what role do you feel like playing today?

Options.PlotLineKey: An improv showcase.
I want to know about you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Take a look, darling. The Masked Reverie has every prop your heart could desire.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or perhaps these don't quite tickle your fancy? Yearning for something a bit more... fantastical, mm?

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A perfume grenade, a pistol ring, or... a luxurious velvet bomb?

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What I crafted for Carlotta, I can certainly craft for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have to say, the requests I've been getting recently... Ugh, so dreadfully uninspired!

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A blade in the shoes? Boring.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A see-through mask? Tasteless.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A firework cane? Oh, please...

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But you, mon chou, you wouldn't disappoint me with you request, would you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whispering Mask, Echo in Finery, Regal Songbird...

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The names and titles the people in Ragunna have for me far exceed the roles I've ever played.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, how many eyes have danced on this invisible shell, weaving tales of my true face?

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You could say that their imaginations have given me a thousand different visages.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What about you? What am I in your mind's eye?

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I sense that, from you, I might finally hear the truth I've been waiting for.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Welcome to the Masked Reverie. Allow me to adorn you with a new identity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like I'm running low on Shell Credits… Guess I'll have to come back another time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I look forward to your next visit. This world of wild dreams is always open to you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please, follow me.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where are we going?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, please allow me to keep that a secret for now—I wouldn't want to spoil the surprise. But here's a hint: you've been there before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, dear Lady Carlotta, thank the Sentinel, you're finally back! I was just about to close up shop to prepare for tomorrow's Carnevale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You have completed my request, haven't you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course, Lady Carlotta. You should have more faith in my skills. Here you are.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A small token of my appreciation. Abby, I have something for you as well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wow, really? I get a gift too? You're so nice!

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, so that's why Lady Carlotta was so insistent on using only the finest materials and meticulous craftsmanship for this piece.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For a moment, I feared she'd lost faith in my skills and was plotting to hand over the shop to someone else...

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But now, I see why this little creation was so important to you, Lady Carlotta. Hehe...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nyarla, you do have a flair for dramatics. Ahem! Anyway, why don't you unwrap it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Th-this is...!

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I took the liberty of having Nyarla custom-make this mask based on my impression of you. I hope it suits your taste.

Options.PlotLineKey: Thank you. I like it very much!
A gift so fine? Does the Montelli family happen to be hiring?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm pleased you like it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Montelli family shares its wealth and opportunities freely, but I see your stage lying beyond the cutthroat games of power and fortune—toward a world that's far more boundless and free.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "The Carnevale is a splendid reverie, and the mask is its passport." May it help you navigate the Carnevale with ease and let you enjoy it to your heart's content.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We will, for sure!

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: May I take up a bit more of your time? Walk with me through Ragunna tonight. I have some additional information to share with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Carlotta takes you to the "Masked Reverie" shop, where she has customized Carnevale masks for you and Abby.
As you walk together under the night sky, Carlotta seems to have more she wishes to discuss...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ragunna, the tempest's jewel, the sapphire that crowns Solaris...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The waters of Ragunna serve as a mirror, reflecting the countless faces of this city—much like our own reflections.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The people of Ragunna possess a temperament akin to the tides, ever-changing. We like to describe ourselves as drifters of currents.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For, to us, drifting is not a negative attribute. It speaks to opportunity, to potential. I find it quite charming, much like your name—Rover—seems to promise.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our founders went with the flow and discovered these islands. Centuries later, the Montellis too drifted with currents, acquiring new technologies from distant lands.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There was a time when the currents swept us into the jaws of uncharted waters, where relentless storms and voracious waves awaited. But after weathering such trials, they revealed to us a hidden gem—the Shores themselves.

Options.PlotLineKey: You're talking about the Black Shores.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My family has always been drawn to the thrill of a new voyage. One stormy night, fate decided to play a hand. What we discovered there on that island, the technology and novel ideas, was nothing short of a blessing in disguise.

Options.PlotLineKey: You sent the troupe to pick me up?
You sent that invitation?
But what's in it for your family? I assume you seek more than just a "free market"?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There exists only one relatively safe route from the Black Shores to Ragunna—a path known solely to the Montelli family. As long as you stayed on this course, you were bound to encounter the troupe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Exactly. When we heard the Black Shores were hunting for a legitimate entry into Ragunna, I thought, why not bring them into our little venture? Hence, the invitation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our intentions might not be as grandiose or ominous as you think. We seek liberation, and to achieve it, we're pursuing the truth behind Rinascita's origins.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Legend has it that when people first arrived on this island, <ano=The first beacon in Rinascita>Genesis Nexus</ano> was already here, welcoming them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The prevailing belief is that the Sentinel gifted us this technology, and despite nobody ever seeing the Sentinel in person, we talk with Them through supposed "telepathy." Notice anything strange about that story?

Options.PlotLineKey: The first beacon…
The Sentinel…

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Terminals conjure up Echoes, and the Genesis Nexus allows the Ragunnesi access to Common Echoes.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If the Genesis Nexus was present when the first settlers arrived, who built it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And really, if no one's ever laid eyes on the Sentinel, how can we be so sure that statue really represents Them?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems to me the Order might have spun us a tale, hiding the true origins behind their grand myths.

Options.PlotLineKey: Does the Montelli family seek to rule?
Are the Montellis turning away from Rinascita's beliefs?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, we have no ambitions to rule or to renounce our faith. And really, this city should not be ruled by any one entity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The hour grows late. I have arranged accommodations for you at Palazzo Agrotta in the south. Let us walk there together, and I can share a story along the way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Think of it as a bedtime tale. I learned it from the troupe. It is about Fleurdelys, the Blessed Maiden.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
During your conversation, Carlotta mentions the Black Shores, revealing that the Montelli family's intentions are more complex than they seem.
The family isn't seeking to usurp the Order's power or undermine the faith. Rather, Carlotta explains, they're pursuing a truth about the origin of Rinascita.
As you walk to Palazzo Agrotta in the southern part of the city, where Carlotta has arranged a room for you, Carlotta shares an old story about Fleurdelys, the Blessed Maiden...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once, the Blessed Maiden was just a simple peasant girl. During the Sentinel's Gratitude Rite, the young Fleurdelys managed to sneak past the guards and drink the sacramental wine—every drop.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps it was the intoxicating wine in Egla Town or simply her lack of experience with spirits, but she soon found herself quite drunk.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Swaying on her feet, she ascended the ceremony's grand platform, lifted her threadbare dress, and began a rather ungainly dance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Seizing the sacred horn, she played a carefree folk tune, dodging the guards and weaving through the crowd with surprising agility.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remarkably, the crowd, as if drawn by an unseen force, followed her lead, transforming the solemn ceremony into a wild parade of cheers and revelry.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Naturally, the Order was less than pleased. The Pilgrim's Sail did not yet exist, so Fleurdelys faced three days of confinement. During that time, she used her prison walls as a canvas.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That unforgettable day of disordered revelry left a lasting mark on all who witnessed it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is it not remarkable? A rebellious girl, chosen by the Sentinel to become the Blessed Maiden.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If the Sentinel indeed permitted such a girl to serve as Their spokesperson, it suggests that all this joyous revelry is not something They disdain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Perhaps They too enjoy poetry, painting, tears, laughter, romantic tales of knights, and dancing amidst crowds—much like ourselves.

Options.PlotLineKey: I believe the same.
The divine is always beyond our comprehension.
Perhaps, the true intention of the Sentinel isn't to rule their people by faith.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The people of this island came from diverse civilizations now lost to time, but through plays and tradition, they sought to preserve memories of their heritage.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the past, while the clash of cultures led to conflict, the Ragunnesi united through faith, restoring balance, even if precarious.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To maintain this unity, we have always needed both a Sentinel and a "play" based on a shared legend that gives us roles.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yet, this play has endured for so long that we have become defined by our roles—noble, commoner, believer, merchant. What was meant to unite us now stifles us.

Options.PlotLineKey: Integration was the past.
Liberation is the present.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, we yearn for a day when we can truly set aside our titles and positions, express our true selves, and join together in celebration...

Options.PlotLineKey: So, this is the true purpose of the Carnevale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, born from hope and idealism, it reminds the Ragunnesi of our initial vision of equality and freedom. It also affirms our true worth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: While the Order's true intentions remain unclear, we are certain their influence has already eroded the very foundations of our society.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: People revere the divine figure the Order has constructed, yet they also live in fear of punishment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Legends become accomplices in fostering ignorance, and faith becomes the loyal executioner of cruel punishment. An invisible cage has trapped us all...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Speaking of freedom within a cage is absurd. Fear and ignorance are our foremost enemies.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This year's Carnevale will spark a flame fierce enough to burn down that cage.

Options.PlotLineKey: Freedom is in our nature.
Our future is in our own hands.
I'll stoke the flames even higher.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rest well, and tomorrow, we shall take the stage together at the Carnevale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good night. May your dreams be sweet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
After finishing her tale, Carlotta confides her deeper thoughts: "If the Sentinel indeed permitted such a girl to serve as their spokesperson, it suggests that all this joyous revelry is not something They disdain."
The Carnevale, she says, is meant to be a celebration of people's true selves. Yet now, it has become a tool for those who use faith to control others. But Carlotta believes that this year's Carnevale can will spark a flame fierce enough to burn down that cage.
Tomorrow, you and Carlotta will take the stage at the Carnevale. Tonight, all you need to do is rest and prepare.

Chapters.Title: Check in to Palazzo Agrotta hotel

Dialogues.Speaker: Concierge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Welcome! Lady Carlotta already notified us of your arrival. We are prepared to check you in whenever you're ready.

Options.PlotLineKey: I would like to rest now.
I have other matters to attend to.

Dialogues.Speaker: Concierge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Very well. I'll escort you to your room immediately.

Dialogues.Speaker: Concierge
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Understood. We will be ready for you when you return!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Get some rest tonight for the Carnevale tomorrow.
Good night. May your dreams be sweet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After all you've been through, your body aches for rest. As you sink into the soft bed, you let your thoughts settle and drift into a peaceful sleep, preparing yourself for the excitement and challenges of the upcoming Carnevale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wow! Is this real? Pinch me. I can't believe how different everything looks! So this is the Carnevale, huh?

Dialogues.Speaker: Anxious Customer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ms. Margherita, is my order ready yet?

Dialogues.Speaker: Impatient Customer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I was about to say, I've been waiting quite a while!

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry, we're swamped with orders! Bakie and I are doing our best, but it's a bit chaotic. Bakie seems to be having some issues too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Bakie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *Beep—Beep—*

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No need to worry. Let me take a look.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, I see. Bakie's just a bit overloaded with all the work. It might need a short break.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh? Good morning, my friend.

Options.PlotLineKey: Maybe you need to put down your work and enjoy the Carnevale.
Why not join me in the celebrations?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'd love to, really. Look... see this mask?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However, it's crystal clear to me that keeping things running smoothly is a top priority right now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lady Carlotta has already briefed me on your plan. Along with the other family members, you can count on my full support.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
A large crowd has gathered in front of Trattoria Margherita. Curious, you approach and spot Zani, who's still hard at work during the festival. After a quick check, she concludes that the Echo "Bakie" is just overloaded with all the work.
After things settle down, Zani assures you that she and the Montelli members will be on duty here, ready to assist you if needed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Get some rest, Bakie! I've got this covered!

Dialogues.Speaker: Margherita
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm giving it my all for the Carnevale. It's been ages since the last one!

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I wish you a wonderful time at the Carnevale!

Dialogues.Speaker: Fulmine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for fulfilling his wish! C-Moss looks so happy!

Dialogues.Speaker: C-MOSS
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *Humph!*

Dialogues.Speaker: Fulmine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you planning to take the stage during the Carnevale? Please, we'd love to document your performance!

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You should take center stage for the final bow, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hear that? The thunderous roar of applause! It has been far too long! This is the true essence of the Carnevale!

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At last, the crisis has been resolved.

Dialogues.Speaker: Onlooker
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that C-MOSS from the Pioneer Association? Something seems off—why does he look sad?

Dialogues.Speaker: C-MOSS
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *Humph…*

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, C-MOSS has been so busy taking photos for everyone else that he hasn't had the chance to take any himself.

Dialogues.Speaker: C-MOSS
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *Humph!*

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm? You want a picture with me? But...

Options.PlotLineKey: I'll take the picture for you.
I'd like to capture this moment.
I don't think there's a rule against taking photos with Echoes, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, hello, {PlayerName}. Well, thank you. Yes... a photo would be wonderful.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
A short distance away, you notice C-MOSS, the Pioneer Association's Echo, looking downcast. Phoebe points out that it's probably disappointed it hasn't been able to capture a photo of itself at the Carnevale.
Snap a picture of C-MOSS and Phoebe together to cheer it up.

Chapters.Title: Take a photo of Phoebe and Echoes

Dialogues.Speaker: Fulmine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, {PlayerName} and Lady Phoebe! I've been capturing the Carnevale's many beautiful moments! What brings you all together here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fulmine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm? You took this picture? Look at that composition and lighting! Who knew you had a knack for photography!

Dialogues.Speaker: Fulmine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Buddy, you look so happy! Whatever the reason, thanks for making this moment special!

Dialogues.Speaker: C-MOSS
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *Humph!*

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's all thanks to {PlayerName}. {Male=He;Female=She} fulfilled C-MOSS's wish.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just like us, C-MOSS wants to savor every moment of the Carnevale and leave with no regrets.

Options.PlotLineKey: You seem excited about the Carnevale too.
Why not join us in the celebration?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sentinel cherishes Their people, and as followers, we find joy in witnessing everyone's happiness.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But we have our duties, ensuring order during the Carnevale. I'm sorry I can't join in the festivities.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phoebe
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I wish you a wonderful time at the Carnevale!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
With C-MOSS's wish granted, Fulmine arrives to thank you for your kindness. Phoebe, however, is bound by her duties to the Order. She needs to maintain order at the festival and can't join you for the rest of the Carnevale.
You can see the excitement and joy in her eyes, though. With her blessings for you in mind, you decide to help keep the Carnevale safe.

Chapters.Title: Meet up with Carlotta at the Liberty Square

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, you're here.

Options.PlotLineKey: It's quite lively.
Anything unusual?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For the Ragunnesi, the Carnevale has always been an occasion to revel with abandon. It's what they truly desire.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All seems well for the moment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The family is prepared. They'll support our plan should the need arise.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We must remain vigilant. The Fractsidus may be lurking, observing our every move.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's nearly time. The troupe should be arriving at the harbor shortly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How do you feel? Ready to step into the spotlight?

Options.PlotLineKey: I couldn't be more ready.
I'm still a bit nervous.
I'm tired of all the formalities.
I have something else to attend to.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Excellent. We have the skills. Now it's all about improvisation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's only natural. It's your first show. If it helps, I'm a bit nervous myself. Let's consider it a rehearsal, shall we? There are grander stages yet to come.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then let's cast aside all inhibitions and dance to the rhythm of this grand celebration!

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll be waiting here for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Carlotta has been waiting for you. The troupe is set to arrive at the port any moment, and your performance is about to start.
If you're ready, it's time to join Carlotta and prepare for the stage.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How do you feel? Ready to step into the spotlight?

Options.PlotLineKey: I couldn't be more ready.
I'm still a bit nervous.
I'm tired of all the formalities.
I have something else to attend to.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Excellent. We have the skills, now it's all about improvisation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's only natural, it's your first show. If it helps, I'm a bit nervous myself. Let's consider it a rehearsal, shall we? There are grander stages yet to come.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then let's cast aside all inhibitions and dance to the rhythm of this grand celebration!

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll be waiting here for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (That woman… she's with the Fractsidus.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I need to follow her and find out what she's planning.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hehe, right this way.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I've lost her again. Where is she trying to lead me?)

Chapters.Title: Examine the Lycoris left by Phrolova

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, we've arrived. Such a small world, isn't it, {PlayerName}?

Options.PlotLineKey: I remember you.
Why did you run?
What is the Fractsidus doing here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, what an honor to be remembered! Let's continue our conversation somewhere lively and grand, a place worthy of the Carnevale, not some dreary, dull corner.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They say the thrill of the chase surpasses the joy of the catch. And with this view of Ragunna, one can truly savor its splendor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, don't fret. I've been invited to this grand feast as a conductor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Decadence, indulgence… Hehe, that's the Carnevale—a vivid daydream and grand illusion for all.

Options.PlotLineKey: Tell me what you really came to say.
Whatever you're plotting, I won't let it happen.
Just so you know, your predecessor's gibberish landed him in prison.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No need to worry, I won't disrupt their little daydream. Besides, we still have business to do here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now that you know what makes the Sentinel so unique, you should know we seek the same thing. That extraordinary Resonator.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How about I share a little story with you? A gesture of goodwill for our cooperation.

Options.PlotLineKey: Go ahead, tell me.
Not interested.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, now. Patience is a virtue. A story is best enjoyed with a captivating performance, and this stage is perfectly set for it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's fine. I do appreciate the noble lady's sentiment—a wise investment often bears fruit in the most unexpected ways.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're simply spreading the truth through a tale. I'm certain it will pique your interest, so consider this a heartfelt invitation to you and your companions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Join us, pour your essence into this endless play, and use your humble strength to defy the raging current of fate!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
The Fool's Troupe makes its grand entrance to thunderous applause, and the city's excitement reaches a fever pitch.
Amid the celebrations, you spot Phrolova, one of the Fractsidus Overseers, moving through the crowd.
You follow her trail to a rooftop, where she invites you to join her. Phrolova reveals that you're both searching for the same "special Resonator." As a gesture of goodwill, she offers to exchange a story with you, one that holds a hidden truth.
Her tale needs a stage, and there is no better stage than Ragunna City at this moment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As anticipated, the Fractsidus is on the move.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, remember the rehearsal we did yesterday? All our preparations have led to this very moment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She intends to use those Lycorises to summon and control the Tacet Discords. If we destroy the Lycorises, we can neutralize them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Everyone is in position. We'll manage the west plaza.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phoebe is stationed at the east plaza, keeping an eye on things.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zani
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The main stage is all yours for the grand performance.

Options.PlotLineKey: To ensure the performance runs smoothly...
...we'll need a host.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll take care of the lighting and create the mood to make the performance stand out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Leave that to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ready? The spotlight will be on you two.

Options.PlotLineKey: Let's go, partner.
We're already part of the play.
As actors, we can't afford to have cold feet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The curtain has been lifted. We can't keep our audience waiting.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then...

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ladies and gentlemen! The grandest and most spectacular performance of the Carnevale is about to commence!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let us give a warm round of applause as our actors now take the stage!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
With Phrolova's opening cue, your performance begins.
Each of your allies plays their part to enhance the show, while the main stage is set for you and Carlotta to shine.

Chapters.Title: Defeat the enemies summoned by Phrolova

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An unending darkness cloaks the kingdom as monstrous beasts ravage the land.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Holy Maiden has been captured by the Demon King, and chaos descends...

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But lo! Two valiant heroes step forth, accepting the minister's quest, vowing to vanquish the beasts and rescue the Holy Maiden!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The heroes breach the first barrier, sweeping away the monsters within the city!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, they advance towards the Demon King's castle, where peril await at every corner... What trials lie ahead?

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phrolova summons a wave of Tacet Discords to block your path, but you and Carlotta manage to break through the obstacle and press on toward her location.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No wall can deter these free spirits, even the stars seem to cheer on their bravery!

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Exercise caution. New enemies have appeared.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Demon King unleashes its minions, long awaiting these audacious intruders...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once again, Phrolova conjures a deadly swarm of Tacet Discords...

Chapters.Title: Defeat the enemies summoned by Phrolova

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They launch a fierce assault, intent on crushing the heroes and grinding them to dust...

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't confront them head-on!

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Watch out!

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah! A sudden twist unbalanced the heroes, then at this crucial moment, a mysterious figure enters the fray!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A Divinity-sent emissary? Or a spirit from the shadows perhaps?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She seems moved by their passion and righteousness,  see her join the heroes' ranks!

Dialogues.Speaker: Demon King (Phrolova)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, how delightful! I await your challenge with bated breath...

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems the Demon King anticipated the heroes' arrival and has gladly extended an invitation...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You and Carlotta are surrounded by TDs, but Roccia arrives in time, diving headfirst into the fight to aid you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With unyielding determination, the heroes accept the challenge!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Demon King reveals itself at last, exposing its hideous visage and sharp fangs. The final showdown is nigh!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Facing Phrolova's taunts, you stand firm and accept her challenge, ready to face the powerful Tacet Discords she has summoned.

Chapters.Title: Defeat the enemies summoned by Phrolova

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Demon King summons its foul army, poised for a climactic battle with the heroes... The victor will soon be revealed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Amidst the clashing swords and the cries of the minions, the heroes face the Demon King—victory belongs to the righteous and the brave!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And now, we await the Holy Maiden's return...

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And so we arrive at the "happily ever after," yes?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But we do not live in a fairy tale. There is no playwright to script a happy ending for us... What lies behind the curtain is but a cruel jest, a dark satire.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let me reveal the truth behind that idyllic ending. The Holy Maiden has long succumbed to darkness, drawing power from a heretical force and leading her people into depravity.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And the minister, having uncovered this truth, has vowed to root out this corruption himself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At last, you reach Phrolova. It seems like the story should end here, but she has one last surprise. Unleashing her powers, she tears through the fabric of space itself, adding yet another twist to your tale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ah, come now. Let us embrace the grand climax of this revelry!

Chapters.Title: Enter the space Phrolova created and witness the story's finale

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems we have received another invitation. The final stage likely lies beyond this point. Are you prepared, {PlayerName}?

Options.PlotLineKey: Yes, I am fully prepared.
I need a moment.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry, Brant will manage everything within the city and make sure that the performance proceeds smoothly as planned.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let us proceed to meet that Fractsidus Overseer and deliver a flawless performance for the Carnevale.

Chapters.Title: Enter the space Phrolova created and witness the story's finale

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "The wildcat has sounded thrice, and the hedgehog four. The peculiar bird sings—the moment is upon us."

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: O benevolent sorceress of realms unknown, I summon you. Grant us a just prophecy, and may fate favor us all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You enter the Sonoro Sphere crafted by Phrolova. Here, she intends to tell you a story about a prophecy...

Dialogues.Speaker: Hecate (Phrolova)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My King, what halts your advance? You have already tainted your feet in the river of blood. There is no retreat.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hecate (Phrolova)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The path born of injustice must be fortified with further transgressions… The soul must be steeled in bitterness.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hecate (Phrolova)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thus, I unveil my second prophecy to dispel all illusions—no mortal shall inflict upon you even the slightest harm.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hecate (Phrolova)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And assuredly, you shall find favor with your people.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hecate (Phrolova)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Defy destiny, mock both life and death, and rise beyond good and evil! Abandon all doubt, and grasp at unreachable hopes...

Dialogues.Speaker: Hecate (Phrolova)
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, hear the third and final prophecy—pleasure born of violence shall end in violence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You should take center stage for the final bow, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hear that? The thunderous roar of applause! It has been far too long! This is the true essence of the Carnevale!

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At last, the crisis has been resolved.

Options.PlotLineKey: It's our hard-earned victory.
They're cheering for us all.

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {Male=Lord;Female=Lady} Arbiter… I have heard… thy call…
I have awaited thee… for what seems like an eternity…

Options.PlotLineKey: I have many questions for you.
How are you holding up?
Where can I find you?

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {Male=Lord;Female=Lady} Arbiter… I am ensnared...
Beyond the clouds and among the stars... thou shalt find an inverted tower suspended in the sky—I am there, watching over Solaris from above.
The Lost... doth wander briefly amongst thy kind...
Seek her out… She, too, doth move within the folds of this festival...

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
You and your companions defeat Phrolova and free Cetus the Tidebreaker from her control. The gloom that had shrouded the Carnevale lifts, and the crowd erupts into applause for your performance.
As daylight breaks through the clouds, a golden Laurel descends over your head, a reward as promised. The Sentinel's voice then echoes in your mind, directing you to Their location. If you wish to find Them, head to the Inverted Tower suspended in the sky, from where They watch over the world.
You notice a hint of vulnerability in the Sentinel's voice. They leave you with a final clue: a "lost" person, someone connected to Them, is currently among the people enjoying the festival.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, well, if it isn't our Laureate for this year! How did you like the mask?

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you enjoyed it, don't be a stranger. Be sure to visit us more often! Hehe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're truly honored that you won the Laurel wearing one of our customized Masks. I must be the first to thank you for that. It's the best kind of publicity we could ask for.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This dream of ours is about to shine even brighter, all thanks to you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Nyarla
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Carlotta has really found a gem this time, hasn't she? Hehe...

Dialogues.Speaker: Appreciative Citizen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Again! Again! That was a great show!

Dialogues.Speaker: Astonished Citizen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Where do these actors come from, though? I heard the Montelli family invited them, but I've never seen them at the previous Carnevales!

Dialogues.Speaker: Appreciative Citizen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How many years has it been since we last held the Carnevale? There must've been a lot of people preparing for this during these years, right? It's not unusual to see fresh faces we don't recognize.

Dialogues.Speaker: Astonished Citizen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, makes sense.

Chapters.Title: Search for the mysterious girl in the crowd

Dialogues.Speaker: Surprised Citizen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did you see that!? There's no such thing as divine punishment. It's all a lie! That sea behemoth from ten years ago? Just a whale!

Dialogues.Speaker: Awestricken Citizen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah... Why didn't we think of that before?

Dialogues.Speaker: Surprised Citizen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Probably because of the fog that year, and all that strange talk from the Order that had everyone on edge...

Dialogues.Speaker: Awestricken Citizen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So then, the ghosts, the dragon, even the fog... Could they all be something else entirely?

Dialogues.Speaker: Surprised Citizen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah! What do you say we team up afterward and head out to the sea to investigate? Maybe we'll uncover some incredible secrets. And who knows? We might just become famous!

Dialogues.Speaker: Thoughtful Citizen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh... Was that all just a dream? The sky was nothing like it is now...

Dialogues.Speaker: Fully Immersed Citizen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think it was just the "special effects" the troupe uses for the show!

Dialogues.Speaker: Thoughtful Citizen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is it...? But the effect felt so... real...

Dialogues.Speaker: Fully Immersed Citizen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, their actors are clearly a bunch of Resonators. And with so many Echoes helping them, it's not impossible to pull off something like that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fully Immersed Citizen
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Think of it as a dream! And honestly, there's nothing wrong with that. The Carnevale is supposed to be dreamy like that!

Dialogues.Speaker: Fulmine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hi Rover! Have you received the photo?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fulmine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was me who captured it—the moment of your grand curtain call! I've already sent it to you from my Terminal!

Dialogues.Speaker: Fulmine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What an incredible show! I could practically feel the heat of it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fulmine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the way, your performance... "Commedia Improvviso," right? What a bold and innovative style of acting...

Dialogues.Speaker: Fulmine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I get the chance, I'd love to make a documentary about your troupe... Wait, scratch that—opportunities are what we make of them, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fulmine
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'll be working on the shooting plan soon, and when the time comes, I'd really appreciate your help in reaching out to the troupe.
The next move is… hmm, am I getting this right? It feels a bit off...

Options.PlotLineKey: Hello.
Try stepping back with your left foot first.
Dancing is not in rigid steps. Let your heart lead the way.

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are…
No, never mind… Anyway, your performance was splendid!
I'm here for the Carnevale as well. It's been ages since I've seen something as grand as this.
I love hearing the laughter and cheers of a crowd, no matter the occasion.
Kind stranger, could you show me those final steps from your curtain call?

Options.PlotLineKey: Your Tacet Mark is glowing.

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sorry, but I can't stay here any longer. I must return...

Options.PlotLineKey: Can you tell me your name before you go?

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My name? It's… um…

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fl… No, I'm Cartethyia… Yes, that's right. Cartethyia.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cartethyia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Farewell, Laureate! I hope that someday, I might stand on stage with your troupe.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you alright, {PlayerName}? Some family members mentioned you were speaking to a wall… I'm worried you might still be under Phrolova's spell.

Options.PlotLineKey: A wall? You didn't see her?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: See who? Are you truly alright?

Options.PlotLineKey: There was a girl here just now. She called herself Cartethyia.
The Sentinel led me to a girl just now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cartethyia… I'll make a note of it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If she was indeed here, she is likely still in Ragunna. I will have my family start searching.

Options.PlotLineKey: Let's not alarm the public just yet.
We should let the Carnevale continue as planned.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There are still many unresolved questions regarding the Order and the Sentinel. We need time to sort through what we've gathered.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rushing into action now might only alert the Order's spies and disrupt what we've worked so hard to protect.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're right.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cartethyia... I will have my family find out more about her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If we find out anything, I'll contact you, and we can discuss our next steps together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Until then, as you suggested…

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's keep this Carnevale going.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Following the Sentinel's lead, you meet a girl named Cartethyia. Something unusual about her frequencies catches your attention, but she disappears into the crowd before you can learn more.
Later, Carlotta arrives and remarks that no one else seems to notice Cartethyia. She offers to have her family members search for the girl in Ragunna, but you urge caution. Too many mysteries surrounding the Order and the Sentinel remain unsolved. Hasty moves could draw unwanted attention from the Order and disrupt the Carnevale. Besides, you need time to piece together the clues you already hold.
For now, you decide to enjoy the festivities.

Chapters.Title: Investigate the trace left by the mysterious girl

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is where the blonde girl stood. Even now, you can sense faint fluctuations in the air. You scan the surroundings, but the mysterious maiden has vanished, leaving no trace behind.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From Carlotta's reaction, it seems that no one but you can perceive her presence.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who is she? Or what is she? Did she only show up for this year's Carnevale?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The path to answers will certainly be treacherous. But regardless, you possess the will, the determination, and the courage to seek the truth. These qualities will see you through.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cartethyia... I will have my family find out more about her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If we find out anything, I'll contact you, and we can discuss our next steps together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Until then, as you suggested…

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's keep this Carnevale going.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hi there! Haha, if it isn't our esteemed Laureate! Finally made it, huh?

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a celebratory dinner hosted by Ms. Carlotta in our honor. And let me tell you—she's quite generous with her money!

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the way, have you heard? The Order has granted our troupe free passage in and out of the city. It sounds like a good deal... but there's something about it that doesn't sit right with me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Look, there's an Acolyte over there. He's probably keeping an eye on us... Hah.

Dialogues.Speaker: Tina
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But enough of that! Here's to you, my friend! To our new Laureate!

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remember, you're not alone. If anything happens, just let us know.
Hey, you! Yes, you, the {Male=gentleman;Female=lady} in black clothes! Over here! In the alley!
Yeah, don't look around. I'm talking to you! There's something I'd like to tell you... I'll be waiting for you in this alley.
Ah, finally. I can tell at a glance that you are not an ordinary person.
You... You must be a Bloom Bearer from the Black Shores, right?

Options.PlotLineKey: Who are you? How did you know?
You are a Bloom Bearer, more Bloom Bearer than I.

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mr. Aalto was right. Bloom Bearers attract other Bloom Bearers!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ariosto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry, I forgot to introduce myself first. My name's Ariosto, and I am the undercover Bloom Bearer sent here to investigate Rinascita's recent issues.

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you the only one they sent here?
Are there any other Bloom Bearers here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ariosto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Black Shores has also sent other Bloom Bearers to Rinascita, but to keep things under the radar of the Order, we decided to split up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ariosto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you head southeast toward Septimont, you'll likely run into some of our colleagues. Compared to Ragunna, Bloom Bearers enjoy a bit more freedom there—less surveillance and fewer rules to follow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ariosto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... how should I put it? Things aren't quite as smooth in Septimont. Our operations face their own set of challenges, and the Bloom Bearers' work there hasn't been progressing as well as we'd hoped.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ariosto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As you know, the Black Shores is a neutral organization, so we don't have the right to meddle in their affairs without the consent of the local officials.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ariosto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our relationship with Rinascita's city-states is… well, "delicate" is one way to put it. We've been providing warnings about the Lament crisis—Ragunna being the prime example, of course.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ariosto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the way... Come closer, gotta keep our voice low for this... Have you run into any... obstructions from the Order during your mission?

Options.PlotLineKey: Indeed I have.
Obstruction is an understatement...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ariosto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. It happened to me as well. On the surface, Ragunna appears peaceful, but behind the scenes, the Order has been plotting something.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ariosto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: People from the Order was hot on my tail when I was investigating this matter, and even had my Terminal taken from me. Luckily the Montellis extended a helping hand...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ariosto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It was the same Ms. Carlotta who told me that a member of the Black Shores would be arriving in Ragunna soon. I decided to find {Male=him;Female=her} quickly and share the information I have.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ariosto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I borrowed this costume and a mask from the Montelli to blend in with the crowd, so I could get back to the city during the Carnevale. Well, at least my hard work finally paid off.

Options.PlotLineKey: That sounds really rough.
How could they treat us like this!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ariosto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Us Bloom Bearers, we endure hardship, but the Lament must be stopped at all costs! That's our Bloom Bearer Creed!

Dialogues.Speaker: Ariosto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You must already have some sense of Ragunna's situation. Now, let me share a wild thought with you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Ariosto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You saw that Sentinel statue in Ragunna, right? That statue is strikingly different from the appearance of Sentinel Imperator we recorded in the Tethys System.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ariosto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, take a deep breath—because I'm about to say something big. What if, just what if... the people of Ragunna have been believing in a false Sentinel all along?

Dialogues.Speaker: Ariosto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait... Enough talk for today. I can't shake the feeling that we're being watched.

Dialogues.Speaker: Ariosto
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My mission isn't finished. I'll stay in Rinascita and continue digging into their historical records about the Sentinel. My next stop is Whisperwind Haven. If fate allows, we'll meet again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With the crisis behind you, you and your companions spend the day basking in cheers and applause.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Later, back at the Palazzo Agrotta, you drift off to sleep, replaying the day's memories from the Carnevale.

Chapters.Title: Head to the family's safe house

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Were you awake, {PlayerName}? I trust you had a restful sleep?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We have uncovered some new information about the Sentinel. Please join us at the family's safe house.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I have sent the address to your Terminal. Brant and Roccia are also here. We are awaiting your arrival.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Raise your glasses! Shout it loud, friends!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To us, to the Carnevale, and to our very own Laureate, {PlayerName}!

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A name that echoes through the world, destined to roam the skies before shaking the earth!

Options.PlotLineKey: Hear, hear! That's me!
Please, stop. You're making me feel embarrassed…

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hahaha! There you are, my friend! A compliment, if too subtle, loses all its charm!

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't be fooled by how he looks. Brant is already deep in his cups, drunk as a skunk.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, let him enjoy himself. The taste of victory is still fresh, and after such a battle, we should celebrate to the fullest!

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Drink your fill, everyone! This round's on me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Everyone
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: HOORAY!!!

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm, I see… Someone's been eavesdropping.

Options.PlotLineKey: Looks like we've attracted some unwanted attention.
Aren't we in your family's safe house?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A devout Acolyte wouldn't enter such a place without a good reason.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Montelli family is known for its hospitality, but freeloaders... will not find us so welcoming.

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Friends, let's keep the mood lively!

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Come, let's discuss the information we've gathered so far.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: During the Carnevale, you heard the Sentinel's voice and found a girl named Cartethyia. We've dug up some information on her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In the Order, every high-ranking Acolyte is given a new name.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We contacted the Acolyte, Phoebe. After some digging in the Order's records, she confirmed that before taking on her holy title, the Blessed Fleurdelys was called... Cartethyia.

Options.PlotLineKey: So, she is the Sentinel's Resonator.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But the Blessed Maiden... she martyred herself twenty years ago...

Options.PlotLineKey: There must be more to it than that...
I just saw a ghost?!
Did someone pretend to be her?
Did the Blessed Maiden suddenly come back from the dead?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The family will uncover the truth. The only remaining clue is the "inverted tower" you mentioned hearing about from the Sentinel, but even that feels elusive...

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Judging by your expression, you must have discovered something new, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you recall what we learned from the stained glass in the Tower Ruins? There were two divinities at the dawn of Rinascita.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If one refers to the Sentinel, then the other, who could stand alongside Them, might be the Threnodian.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The two are undoubtedly linked, so uncovering one could lead us to the other.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remember Gilberto, from the Fisalia family? It took a lot to get him to talk, but we finally got some information from him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As he tells it, the Fisalia family's long-revered deity is none other than... Leviathan, the Threnodian from the sea's depths.

Options.PlotLineKey: They worship the Threnodian…

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's hard to believe, I know. But recent events have only reinforced what we discovered from the stained glass.

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Fisalia family has been on this island since the founding of Rinascita, so their worship of the Threnodian may have persisted for centuries.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We will attempt to establish contact with the Fisalias to build an alliance and gather more intelligence.

Options.PlotLineKey: Do you think they'll be willing?

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rest assured, negotiation is what we do best. If necessary, we'll present them with an offer they can't refuse.

Dialogues.Speaker: Quiet Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Excuse me for the interruption. Greetings, esteemed guest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Quiet Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Primus wishes to invite you for a conversation at the Cathedral of Mercury. Would you be so inclined?

Dialogues.Speaker: Brant
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How curious. Since when has the Primus become so interested in social calls?

Dialogues.Speaker: Roccia
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It could very well be a trap.

Dialogues.Speaker: Quiet Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm merely conveying the Primus' invitation. The choice is yours.

Options.PlotLineKey: Don't worry, he wouldn't dare do anything to me.
Perfect timing. I have many questions for him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Carlotta
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Remember, you're not alone. If anything happens, just let us know.

Dialogues.Speaker: Quiet Acolyte
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Very well, please follow me to the Cathedral of Mercury.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Carlotta invites you to the Montelli family's safe house for a celebratory dinner. You and your friends raise a glass and share a rare moment of laughter. During the gathering, Carlotta reveals that Cartethyia is actually Fleurdelys, the Blessed Maiden. This new information helps you piece together the clues you've uncovered.
Carlotta also shares a shocking revelation from Gilberto regarding the history recorded in the ruins: The Fisalia family actually worships the Threnodian known as the "Leviathan" from the deep sea, a belief that may date back centuries. Rinascita's Sentinel and the Threnodian are connected, and if the situation demands, the Montelli family might seek a conversation with the Fisalia family.
Meanwhile, the Montellis will keep investigating the mysterious Inverted Tower, the other clue left by the Sentinel.
Soon after, you receive an invitation from the Primus, Fenrico, to the Cathedral of Mercury.

Chapters.Title: Go to the Cathedral of Mercury
Go to the Cathedral of Mercury

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Never before have I seen a day so steeped in both shadow and light.
The birds sing, the flowers bloom… yet this world knows neither true joy nor eternity.
Come closer, Righteous One, there's no need for hesitation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am Fenrico, the Primus of the Order of the Deep. Your deeds have reached my ears, and I have long wished to meet you. Alas, the burdens of this world delayed our meeting until now. I beg your pardon for the wait.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please accept my respect for you—you and your troupe have shown great talent and ambition, breathing new life into Ragunna.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I ask you to deliver this message to your companions: from this day forth, the troupe shall have permanent rights to perform within the city.

Options.PlotLineKey: I surely will.
Even if they're all Fools?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All mortals stumble, but through pilgrimage, they have cleansed their souls and atoned for their transgressions. They have earned their right to return to this divinely blessed land.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I understand that questions weigh on your heart. In the presence of a just Divinity, speak freely, and I will answer with all the honesty I possess.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: By the great Sentinel Imperator, I swear to you. There shall be no deceit in my words.

Options.PlotLineKey: I want to meet the Sentinel Imperator.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You have walked a path similar to Theirs. Indeed, you have the right to meet Them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However, due to the Dark Tide two decades ago, the Sentinel's body was gravely wounded and remains in a state of recovery.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you wish to meet Them, I will convey your request.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see the thirst for truth in your eyes. It is clear that doubts still linger in your heart. Please, voice your concerns.

Options.PlotLineKey: Tell me about the Blessed Fleurdelys.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fleurdelys... She was the emissary of the Sentinel, and we are grateful for her contributions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Twenty years ago, during the Dark Tide, she sacrificed herself to seal the calamity. She fulfilled her duties in this world and returned to the divine embrace.

Options.PlotLineKey: Returned to the divine embrace?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you know how the Dark Tide came into being?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In Rinascita, wars were waged in the name of faith, tearing apart the Sentinel as our faith divided, weakening Their divine power.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Dark Tide's true essence is the divine blood shed from the Sentinel's wounds.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That tragic past left deep scars, and with Their divine power drained, They could not prevent the Dark Tide's surge twenty years ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Blessed Maiden chose to martyr herself. She once again resonated with the Sentinel and, through her sacrifice, restored some of Their divine power, bringing an end to the Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yet, the Sentinel remains in a state of healing and still requires a mortal representative. Following the Blessed Maiden's departure, I was granted new authority to cleanse the aftermath of the Dark Tide.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I received the Divinity's blessing and became the new Enlightened One. By Their will, I fulfill the tasks left unfinished in this world.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Therefore, we must unify all beliefs, ensuring the purity and unity of our will to prevent another tragedy...

Options.PlotLineKey: (Reflect on the Blessed Maiden's Second Resonance with the Sentinel.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (He said she "once again resonated with the Sentinel," was that really a Second Resonance Awakening? Sentinel Jué had a trial with Jinhsi, but my permission was needed to transfer the Sentinel's power...)

Options.PlotLineKey: You're hiding things from me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I swear, my words are without deceit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see in your eyes that you have walked further on the path of justice than I anticipated.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: O dear Sentinel… please forgive my transgressions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Dark Tide brought us a bloodstained lesson. To keep our people from faltering, I bound myself to silence, locking away what I witnessed on that fateful day.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fleurdelys, the Unrighteous, deceived us all. She was not the Blessed Maiden chosen by the Sentinel... The true maiden has yet to reveal herself.

Options.PlotLineKey: Why did people believe she was the Blessed Maiden?
Where did her power to seal the Dark Tide come from?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You must know that a being capable of rivaling our Divinity exists in this world—humanity's eternal adversary, the evil of all civilizations... the Threnodian.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As the Sentinel has Their Resonator, so does the Threnodian.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fleurdelys was shaped—both body and spirit—by our ancient enemy. Her actions were intended to plunge this city into fear and chaos.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fenrico
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is the truth I witnessed—Fleurdelys was the Threnodian's Resonator.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
At the Cathedral of Mercury, you meet Fenrico. He apologizes for Alessio and others' deeds and promises to answer your questions as best he can.
In his words about the Sentinel, you catch a mention of the "Second Resonance Awakening." This raises suspicion—such a transfer of power from the Sentinel would require your permission.
When you press Fenrico about the true fate of Fleurdelys, he finally reveals a long-held secret: Fleurdelys was the Threnodian's Resonator.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How can that be? That Blessed Maiden... could she really be the Threnodian's Resonator? What if the Primus's words were a bunch of baloney?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But we saw Cartethyia following the Sentinel's instructions... They wouldn't mix up Their own Resonator, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh, now my head hurts... Who was she really with? The Sentinel? Or the Threnodian?

Options.PlotLineKey: He didn't seem like he was lying.
He definitely seemed like he was hiding something important.
Ugh, my head is starting to hurt too...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, probably won't get any more answers from him...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All the clues we've gathered so far point to the Threnodian.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And the Fisalia family worships the Threnodian. We'll have to wait for Carlotta to arrange an audience with them.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Something tells me this Carnevale is just the beginning. There's more ahead, I'm sure of it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
After leaving the Cathedral, you discuss the findings with Abby. Every clue now seems to point back to the Threnodian mysteries, and you'll have to wait for Carlotta to contact the Fisalia family.
Gazing out over the tranquil sea of Rinascita, you feel a shiver of foreboding. The Carnevale is only a prologue... Everything is just beginning.
Phrolova, you do have a knack for indulging in... pointless little chores.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why, there's no rule against an actor making good use of the intermission.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Besides, I haven't disrupted your arrangement, have I?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "The one from a faraway land who discerns the truth dares to raise their sword against the divine. In response, the slumbering gods break free from their shackles, revealing their true forms..."

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The possibility of the Second Resonance Awakening is now a certainty. So we just need to see if that special Resonator truly exists.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Was the Blessed Maiden a Resonator for the Sentinel or the Threnodian?

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or both? If so... Oh, a Resonator capable of wielding both powers... I am eager to see how this story ends.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Cristoforo, if you don't want to spoil the next act, I might have to give your carefully crafted plot a little nudge.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Speaking of which, {PlayerName} shines brighter than anyone else in your play. Do you find {Male=him;Female=her} interesting as well?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Phrolova, it seems we walk different paths. I don't share your fondness for that sort of... puppet theater.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I merely place the characters on their stage and they act out their fates, driven by their own volition.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: To remain courageous amidst absurdity, to pursue a spark of divine grace—this, to me, is the truest essence of humanity, don't you think?

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even the most pristine cadence of death pales beside the untamed, fervent, and tenacious spirits of the living.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In their journey, they resolutely overcome all obstacles: they pursue, they tear, they burn—simply because they desire to.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think you should leave your secluded mansion. Take a walk and listen to the voices scattered across the world.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …Perhaps.

Dialogues.Speaker: Phrolova
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From Huanglong to Rinascita, {Male=he;Female=she} has indeed added a few unexpectedly beautiful notes to my symphony.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am certain that, even without any direction, {Male=he;Female=she} will walk the path that destiny has laid before {Male=him;Female=her}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: All things ascend towards a singular point of convergence, and what awaits at the end is... immortality.

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before the tides of fate, we are all but…

Dialogues.Speaker: Cristoforo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …humble servants.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey:
Not far away, Phrolova watches your every move. Beside her stands another Overseer, Cristoforo the "Playwright."
It seems his script is only starting to unfold...
